channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7250] create integration test for balancing regions and killing region servers - 2
item.description: The original test is too general; need another one that would be more targeted and would test master logic in particular (e.g. not kill master). I re-discovered HBASE-6060 using it on the first run
item.summary: create integration test for balancing regions and killing region servers - 2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12555593/HBASE-7250-v0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 5 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 99 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 26 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

@Sergey:
Can you share with us the test result when you run IntegrationTestRebalanceAndKillServersTargeted locally ?


+    protected Random random = new Random();

Suggest using 'new SecureRandom()' on the right hand side above.


+  /** This action is too specific to put in ChaosMonkey; put it here */

+  static class ChaosMonkeyAction extends ChaosMonkey.Action {

nit: it would be nice if the action class name can be bit more descriptive.

renamed the action; wrt SecureRandom - are you sure it's necessary? Nothing particularly security-sensitive about ChaosMonkey. Or is it a general guideline to use it?

On minicluster, the test fails, I only ran it on full cluster before... I will see why it fails, looks like clients aren't syncing meta properly.

after fixing some issue that I found the test still fails to put w/no useful logging... I will add logging tomorrow to debug it more.
Meanwhile, the patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12555890/HBASE-7250-v1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 5 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 101 warning messages.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 26 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.TestReplication

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3442//console

This message is automatically generated.

Something wrong in the class comment here?


"hbase.IntegrationTestRebalanceAndKillServers  s.runtime"

Should you say anything in class comment about which configs effect data size, how frequently the kills run, etc? I see the class comment as what a user will peruse figuring if they want to run the test. Should list the knobs to twiddle I'd say.

Should the numbers provided here be configurable?

+ runIngestTest(DEFAULT_RUN_TIME, 2500, 10, 100, 20);

Patch looks good to me.

Should the numbers provided here be configurable?

Some of them, probably... maybe with base class participating. Although they should be changeable together with all other test parameters.

Rest - fixed.
Patch comment: test definitely passes w/HBASE-7268; w/o 7268 it may fail, especially on minicluster.

The original test is too general; need another one that would be more targeted and would test master logic in particular (e.g. not kill master)

Is the first test useful on it's own?

Other than that, the patch looks good.

Is the first test useful on it's own?

Not sure; it also kills master, but doesn't really test any particular scenario. Do you want to remove it?

+1 on patch.
+1 on removing a test that is too general especially since it has not yet been included in a release. Can do in another issue? Let me commit this one.
You want to backport this Sergey? I added your class comment as release note – feel free to edit. Thanks for the nice test. +1 on removing useless test in new issue. Committed to trunk. Thanks lads.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: A system test which does large data ingestion and verify using {@link LoadTestTool}, while introducing chaos by hoarding many regions into few servers (unbalancing), then killing some of these servers, and triggering balancer. It's configured using a set of constants on top, which cover this scenario and are reasonable for minicluster. See constants if you want to tweak the test. You can configure how long the test should run by using. "hbase.IntegrationTestRebalanceAndKillServersTargeted.runtime" configuration parameter, which is probably most useful on cluster.
